meanings.definition: To subject to a severe trial or torment.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will basan the students with a difficult exam.
meanings.sent2: She basaned herself by taking on too many responsibilities at once.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf decided to basan the town by hiding all the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to basan the small boat with its fierce winds and crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was said to basan anyone who dared to enter its dark halls.

meanings.sent1: The basan haunted the old castle, scaring away all who approached.
meanings.sent2: Legend has it that a basan roams the forest at night, seeking its next victim.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous basan played pranks on the villagers, causing chaos and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The basan's presence in the house was felt as a chilling breeze on warm summer nights.
meanings.sent5: Children whispered tales of the basan, warning each other to stay away from the abandoned well.
